base

Class IndexedNeighborGraphBase<S>

  • java.lang.Object
    • base.NeighborGraphBase<S,java.util.List<S>>
      • base.IndexedNeighborGraphBase<S>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - The vertex type on which the graph structure is defined.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IndexedNeighborGraph<S>, NeighborGraph<S>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IndexedNavigableRootedNeighborGraphBase, IndexedNeighborGraphBuilder

    public class IndexedNeighborGraphBase<S>
extends NeighborGraphBase<S,java.util.List<S>>
implements IndexedNeighborGraph<S>
    Extension of NeighborGraphBase<S, List<S>> which serves as a base implementation of the IndexedNeighborGraph<S> interface.

    Note that by having the second type parameter of NeighborGraphBase set to List<S>, the neighbor collections are then maintained as Lists. Accordingly, the getNeighborsOf(S s) method has been overridden to return a List<S>.

    The constructors for this class are designed to be called by the constructors of its subclasses, and ultimately the builder subclasses (ie those which implement the ModifiableNeighborGraph<S> interface).

    The setFinished() method is designed to be called within the implementation of the finish() method of the builder subclasses. A call to this method method sets the building state of the graph to finished, and sorts the neighbor lists according to the indexing of the vertices.

    The indexing functionality of this class is delegated to the two nested classes Indexing<T> and IndexComparator<T>.
    Author:
    pdokos

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  IndexedNeighborGraphBase.IndexComparator<T>
      Implementation of the java.util.Comparator<T> interface based on Indexing<T>.
      protected class  IndexedNeighborGraphBase.Indexing<T>
      A nested class of IndexedNeighborGraphBase, serving to index the vertex set of the graph with the natural numbers (starting at 1) by maintaining a Map<T, Integer> together with an ArrayList<T>.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IndexedNeighborGraphBase

        public IndexedNeighborGraphBase()
        Constructor for an IndexedNeighborGraphBase. This constructor initializes the neighborsMap to a new HashMap<S, T>, and also initializes the Indexing<S> and IndexComparator<S>.

      • IndexedNeighborGraphBase

        public IndexedNeighborGraphBase(int degree)
        Constructor for an IndexedNeighborGraphBase which is of uniform vertex degree (i.e. a regular graph). This constructor initializes the neighborsMap to a new HashMap<S, T>, and also initializes the Indexing<S> and IndexComparator<S>.
        Parameters:
        degree - the designated valency of each vertex.

      • IndexedNeighborGraphBase

        public IndexedNeighborGraphBase(int numVerts,
                        int degree)
        Constructor for an IndexedNeighborGraphBase which has a known number of vertices and is of uniform vertex degree (i.e. a regular graph). This constructor initializes the neighborsMap to a new HashMap<S, T> with initial capacity numVerts and load factor 1, and also initializes the Indexing<S> and IndexComparator<S>.
        Parameters:
        numVerts - the designated number of vertices of the graph.
        degree - the designated valency of each vertex.

    • Method Detail

      • setFinished

        protected void setFinished()
        Sets the state of construction to finished, and sorts the neighbor lists according to the indexing. This action cannot be undone, and subsequent calls to isFinished() return true. Builder subclasses should call this method within their implementations of the finish() method. If the graph was specified as regular, or as having a certain number of vertices upon construction, then this method should only be called when these conditions are true.
        Overrides:
        setFinished in class NeighborGraphBase<S,java.util.List<S>>

        Parameters:

        maxIncl - any integer
        Returns:
